page.title: 15Recreation Grounds.Brownies
page.content: {The recreation ground} was given to the village by Mr Fairthorne in 1897 for use as a cricket pitch. In the 1950's a sports club was formed and football was played as well. The recreation ground is now owned by the Parish Council and also has some swings and a see saw. Nearby are the alotments. {King's Meadow} This is another recreation ground and was part of a development of new houses near the Village School. There are tennis courts, a playfort, a BMX cycle track and grass play areas. {Brownies} The leader of the pack is Miss Gaines and we meet in the Village Hall every Wednesday from 6.00 to 7.30pm. We pay 30p each week. Our sixes are called Elves, Lepracorns, Gnomes and Pixies. We join Brownies at 7 years and leave at 11.
